Articles.Content:
today a scientist figured out that the fly on his telescope was not a fly at all. IT WAS KERBIN X! baffled they consulted sources and came upon a newspaper reel on the successful return of an expedition to kerbin X. So it was that kerbin X was rediscovered.... again. this was before we started the ksp so shut up

kerbin X is to say the least a very strange rock. its orbit is highly elliptical and its orbital period is roughy 4 years almost like a comet. As it gets closer to the sun it becomes kerbin like almost too kerbin like. its oceans melt (can we do this with the engine?). and it turns a green hue (unknown if it is biologic). even stranger is the fact that mountains seem to rise up as it nears its periapsis and and shrink as it retreats from the sun. Maybe something is underneath the surface? A massive underground ocean for a crust bordering the mantle perhaps?

CLASSIFIED INFO BELOW 

spectral analysis shows strange metals, unnatural metals, in huge massive quan------- TRANSMISSION LOST----------------------------------------------
